topic.title: Steps to Ensure the Engine and Components are Safe to Work On
topic.shortdesc: Follow these steps to ensure the termic (combustion) engine and its components are safe to work on before performing any maintenance.

li.p: Turn Off the Engine: Make sure the engine is completely turned off and the key is removed from the ignition to prevent accidental starting.
Allow Engine to Cool: Wait for the engine to cool down to avoid burns or other injuries. This usually takes about 30 minutes after the engine has been running.
Disconnect the Battery: Disconnect the negative terminal of the car battery to cut off the power supply, reducing the risk of electrical shocks.
Use Personal Protective Equipment (PPE): Wear appropriate PPE such as gloves, safety glasses, and long sleeves to protect yourself from potential hazards.
Work in a Well-Ventilated Area: Ensure you are working in an area with good ventilation to avoid inhaling any harmful fumes or gases.
Secure the Vehicle: Use wheel chocks to prevent the car from moving. Engage the parking brake and ensure the vehicle is on a flat, stable surface.
Refer to the Manual: Always consult the vehicle's service manual for specific safety instructions related to the termic motor.
